result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Nichole M. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nichole M. Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nichole M. Johnson was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Nichole M. Johnson
Current: 304 South Second St, Benld, IL 62009 United States  (Effective: 04-13-2016)
Prior: 210 Highview Parkway, Rhinelander, WI 54501

Defendant Nichole M. Johnson in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:02
Defense motion to modify sentence - Court statement regarding children's court-and children now in different state - Mis probation is not transferable to other states - 
Court questions defendant - Schiek statement - still subject to Deferred judgment - Court grants motion and terminates probation - Payment plan to be set up prior to defendant leaving the state and make all payments -  Deferred judgment still stands along with all conditions of testifying truthfully against co defendants if needed - bail continued
Motion hearing on April 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

9:21 a.m. Defendant Nichole M. Johnson in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CF296. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed; Information filed. Schiek speaks to agreement/resolution. State moves to dismiss Cts. 1, 3, 5 in 15CF285; granted by the Court. State moves to dismiss 15CF296; granted by the Court. Defendant pleads no contest to Cts. 2 & 4. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2; defers entry of judgment to Ct. 4. Schiek/Bennett sentencing. Court statement. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Bennett speaks to bond modification - defendant has secured employment; requests residency restriction lifted. Court notes not applicable; not included as part of bond. 

Court sentence
WHS - Ct. 2
12 mos. POP
Compliance with children court order
CC/CV/Surcharges/Supervision fees
DNA sample
Appeal rights

Ct. 4
12 mos. DEJ - 12/10/16 Review Hearing--Bond continued

NO contact WHATSOEVER with Chantil Rahlf, Joel Hughes or Justin Helvey, including third-party contact. May have telephonic or electronic contact with Justin Helvey ONLY for purposes of mutual parental responsibilities and court appearances concerning minor children.

2:49 p.m. Defendant Nichole M. Johnson in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett, telephonically, with leave of court.  Defendant Nichole M. Johnson in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett requests adjournment of preliminary hearing - requests to be heard on motion to modify bond today. Bennett/Schiek/Court questions defendant regarding Ms. Ray/Court statement to motion. Court modifies bond - requires surety - if Patricia Ann Ray co-signs as surety - should be converted to $10,000 surety bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

1:53 p.m. Defendant Nichole M. Johnson in court via video with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Nichole M. Johnson in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Bennett moves to modify bond. Schiek statement to bond. Court statement to bond. Court denies motion to modify bond. 
Bail continued. Adj. 1:58 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

NO contact WHATSOEVER with Chantil Rahlf, Joel Hughes or Justin Helvey, including third-party contact. May have telephonic or electronic contact with Justin Helvey ONLY for purposes of mutual parental responsibilities and court appearances concerning minor children.

1:45 p.m. Defendant Nichole M. Johnson in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond. Adj. 1:52 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
